TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/StartPanel/ProgListSeparator extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a for the bar that separates groups of items in the left side of the **Start** menu. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.ProgListSeparator.Normal%2A> property of the VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.ProgListSeparator class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents the bar that separates groups of items in the left side of the **Start** menu.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.StartPanel.ProgListSeparator.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelProgListSeparator1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#220](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/6520fec0-42af-4806-a38c-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#220](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/6520fec0-42af-4806-a38c-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the bar that separates groups of items in the left side of the **Start** menu.
Docs.value: A that represents the bar that separates groups of items in the left side of the **Start** menu.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStartPanelProgListSeparator1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#220](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/d34f2136-0cc7-4ecf-b21d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#220](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/d34f2136-0cc7-4ecf-b21d-_1.vb)]
